III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10171 Resident confinement room; approved
Section usage
Description A facility approved to use a resident confinement room may place
a resident in this room for the following reasons:
(b) For medical reasons.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On or around 2/17/25, a youth was placed in confinement for
having a suspected STI.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on April 7, 2025. Staff 1
reported that she heard complaints from other staff members at
the facility that Youth A was confined to her room during her time
at the facility because she had a sexually transmitted infection
(STI). She reported she was not there when Youth A was confined
to her room but heard it from other staff as they felt Youth A was
being discriminated against. Staff 1 did not want to provide the
names of the staff that shared these concerns. She reported there
have been other youth at the facility who had STIs, and they were
never isolated in their room. Staff 1 reported that Manager was the
one to approve of this isolation and she believes Manager did this
because Youth A did not want to talk with Manager. She reported
she attempted to look at the documentation about this approved
isolation and could only find it in a daily note that Youth A was on
medical isolation. Staff 1 reported that she felt this situation was
not a common protocol as there was no documentation and no
other youth had gone on medical isolation for this before.
Youth A was interviewed face to face via Microsoft TEAMS on
April 10, 2025. Youth A reported when she first arrived at the
facility on February 17, 2025, she had to stay in medical isolation
until she was able to meet with Nurse. She reported that the
reason she had to stay in medical isolation was because she was
pregnant and reported she was harmed by police before coming
to the facility. Youth A reported she understood the reasoning and
was only there for a few hours. She reported staff were constantly
checking on her when she was in medical isolation which made
her frustrated because she just wanted to be left alone. Youth A
reported she did not like the staff at the facility because they
would make her frustrated with the rules. She reported the only
staff she liked at the facility were Nurse and Manager. Youth A
reported she felt those were the only two people there who cared
2

about her and wanted her to make positive choices. She reported
she enjoyed talking to Manager as she was a therapist and could
process her frustrations with her.
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 8,
2025. Nurse reported Youth A arrived at the facility on February
17, 2025. She reported she was called by Manager after Youth
A’s intake assessment due to reported concerns. Nurse reported
when Youth A was completing her intake, she reported she was
pregnant, thrown down by police, and had three sexually
transmitted infections (STI). She reported receiving this
information from Manager. Nurse reported she investigated Youth
A’s medical history and found that Youth A was prescribed
antibiotics in December 2024 for her STIs but never picked up the
prescriptions. Nurse reported due to Youth A having confirmed
STIs and not being on medications she called Manager and
requested Youth A to be put in medical isolation until she can get
the antibiotics. She reported she went to pick up Youth A’s
antibiotics on the same day of her arrival and then completed her
medical assessment of Youth A. Nurse reported Youth A was only
placed in medical isolation for a couple of hours and went into the
general population again the next morning. She reported Youth A
went into isolation because it was confirmed that she could be
spreading a disease and wanted to make sure she started
medication before going into the general population.
Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
15, 2025. Manager reported she is the clinical manager for the
facility and recently came into this role. She reported within her
role she receives the notification when a youth is about to be
lodged at their facility and tries to review their history before being
placed. Manager reported she received notification that Youth A
was going to be picked up by police on February 17, 2025, at
1:22pm. She confirmed the email report from the court of Youth
A’s pick-up court order to this consultant. She reported she began
to review Youth A’s historical file to see what needs Youth A may
have. Manager reported she saw a note from December 11, 2024,
which noted, “We have a medical situation with Youth A right now
that could be life-threatening. She needs this medication.” The
next note from January 2, 2025, noted, Youth A continued to
remain AWOL since December 8, 2024, and stated “there is
ongoing concern that Youth A is without her antibiotic or
medication. She has a kidney infection from untreated STIs that
she is supposed to be on medication for.” Manager showed both
these notes to this consultant. She reported after she reviewed
past notes she sent out an email to Supervisor 2 and Nurse about
3

the intake of Youth A coming to the facility with the noted
concerns of Youth A needing antibiotic medications. The email
was reviewed which was dated February 17, 2025, at 1:34pm.
The email chain did show confirmation of Supervisor 2 responding
and looking into Youth A’s medication needs and talking with
Nurse. She reported Youth A was brought to the facility around
2:00 pm and began to do the intake process with Supervisor 2.
Manager reported she attempted to call Nurse via phone at
2:47pm which Nurse sent her a text message back. She reported
she talked with Nurse about the concerns of Youth A’s untreated
medical concerns and pregnancy. Manager reported Nurse
requested for Youth A to go into medical isolation until she could
come see her at the detention center which was around 6:45pm
that evening. She showed this consultant these text messages
which verified the time was correct from her interview. Manager
reported while she was on her way to the facility to meet with
Youth A, she attempted to stop by Walgreens to pick up Youth A’s
medication but was unable to do so due to needing a new doctor's
authorization. She reported rather than waiting for the medications
she went to the facility so Nurse could pick up the medications on
her way in. Manager reported she could not remember exactly
when she arrived to the facility but when she was there, Youth A
had already been processed by Supervisor 2 and was in the gym
with the other peers. She reported she requested Supervisor 2 to
get Youth A out of the gym and be brought to the medical area so
that Youth A could talk with Manager and wait for Nurse to get
there. She reported this was around 3:00pm and Youth A came up
around 3:30pm. Manager reported she was able to speak with
Youth A who reported when she was getting picked up by police,
an officer restrained her and threw her to the ground. Youth A was
concerned about this because she was pregnant and was worried
her baby was harmed. Youth A began to get irritable within the
medical isolation room because she did not want to be locked up
in detention and was having a difficult time processing her trauma.
Manager reported she stepped out of the room around 5:00pm
which is when Youth A went into official medical isolation until
Nurse arrived at 6:44pm. After the medical exam, Youth A went
back to her room for the rest of the night for bed. Manager did
show this consultant the documentation on the computer of the
15-minute checks being completed at 5:00pm until Nurse arrived
and completed her assessment. Manager reported she followed
through with the request of Nurse for medical isolation due to
untreated STI concerns and concerns about the assault by police
with being pregnant. She reported there have been youth in the
past that have been admitted with an STI that did not need
4

medical isolation but that was because they were on antibiotics
already and were previously medically cleared.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
April 8, 2025. Supervisor 1 reported Manager and Nurse have
permission to put a youth into medical isolation. He reported he
was not present when Youth A was admitted into the facility on
February 17, 2025. Supervisor 1 reported medical isolation is
treated like disciplinary confinement where written approval and
checks need to be completed every fifteen minutes. He reported
Staff 2 and Supervisor 2 were working with Youth A when she was
admitted into the facility and then went into medical isolation.
Supervisor 1 reported staff at the facility have been upset with
recent changes at the facility as there has been a new
administration team coming in such as Manager and Nurse. He
went through Youth A’s file with this consultant which showed the
note from Manager on February 17, 2025, showing Nurse
requesting medical isolation. Supervisor 1 showed this consultant
the documentation of the fifteen-minute checks that were
completed in the system and were completed appropriately.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via phone on April 24,2025.
Supervisor 2 reported she was involved in the intake process of
Youth A coming into the facility on February 17,2025. She
reported when Youth A was processed, she was released into the
general population. Supervisor 2 reported she received a call from
Manager stating Nurse asked for Youth A to go into medical
isolation due to untreated medical concerns and pregnancy
concerns. She reported after Youth A was done in the gym; she
was brought to medical isolation for a couple of hours to meet with
Nurse for medical care. Supervisor 2 stated she did not feel Youth
A was being discriminated against or that the proper protocol was
not being followed. She reported the next day Youth A was back
to normal activity.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 8,
2025. Staff 2 reported he was working when Youth A arrived at
the facility on February 17, 2025. He reported Supervisor 2
completed Youth A’s intake and then Youth A joined the general
population. Staff 2 reported he took Youth A into the gym with the
other youth to play basketball. He reported while he was in the
gym he received a call from Supervisor 2 stating Manager was
requesting Youth A go into medical isolation due to her sexually
transmitted infection (STI). Staff 2 reported Youth A was upset
because she was already put into the general population but
followed the direction. He reported that he was confused about
5

why this was occurring because he was aware of other youth that
had STIs upon arrival and they did not need medical isolation.
Staff 2 reported Youth A did not go into medical isolation until after
5:00pm and then it was bedtime at 8:45pm so she was only in
isolation for a few hours. He reported that she did receive her
antibiotics which ended the isolation. Staff 2 reported there were
fifteen-minute checks completed while Youth A was in medical
isolation.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility Juvenile Rights: Access to Programs and
Services Policy with review date of 11/25/2022- This
policy notes all youth should have an equal opportunity to
participate in and have access to facility programs and
services. Under no circumstances shall a youth be
discriminated against based upon race, religion, national
origin, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or political
views.
- Facility Health Screening and Examinations Policy with
review date of 10/24/2022- This policy notes that when a
youth arrives at the facility a medical assessment will be
completed by a medically trained professional. The medical
professional is to look into current illness and health
problems, including sexually transmitted diseases (std) and
other infectious disease.
- Facility Medical Health Care policy for Chronic,
Convalescent and Prosthetic Care with a review date of
10/24/2022- This policy notes that once a health need has
been identified, medical personnel will indicate the
appropriate preventive maintenance which will be
implemented by staff. The policy further notes that the
nature of the medical problem will determine the need for
the removal of the residents from the general population.
When the need for removal is indicated, the resident may
be held and supervised in the infirmary in the secure
detention wing of the facility.
- Email from Foster Care Worker dated 04/07/2025- Foster
Care Worker reported she was not aware of Youth A being
confined to her room at the facility. She reported the facility
and Youth A never brought this up to her. Foster Care
Worker reported on 02/18/2025 she visited Youth A and
6

she was in a group class, not confined to her room, and this
was after Nurse had seen her for a physical exam and was
made aware of the STI’s. Youth A was placed at the facility
from 02/17/2025-02/21/2025.
- Text Message from Nurse to Manager dated 02/17/2025
at 2:17pm- This text message chain is referred to in the
interview with Manager. Nurse provided permission for
Youth A to go into medical isolation until she was able to
get to the facility for an evaluation.
- Youth A’s File- File records of Youth A were reviewed.
o Note dated 12/11/2024- This was a court hearing
note which noted Youth A was AWOL. There were
concerns with a medical situation for Youth A. The
note stated “We have a medical situation with her
right now that could be life threatening. She needs
this medication.”
o Note date 01/02/2025- A weekly meeting with
Foster Care Worker- Youth A remains AWOL since
12/8/2024. This note stated, “There is ongoing
concern that Youth A is without antibiotic medication.
She has a kidney infection from untreated STIs that
she is supposed to be on medication for.”
o Note dated 02/17/2025 at 2:10pm completed by
Manager- This note was consistent with her
interview about Youth A’s intake and the concerns of
medical needs. This note also noted the approval of
medical isolation from Nurse which started at
5:00pm.
o Note dated 2/17/2025 at 6:45pm completed by
Nurse- Nursing assessment was being completed.
Youth A went back to her personal room at the
facility post assessment for bed. Youth A started her
antibiotics. Note was consistent with Nurse
interview.
o Confinement checks for 02/17/2025- There were
15-minute checks noting Youth A’s confinement form
5:00pm to 7:30pm. Youth A then went to her room
for bedtime routine.
Analysis The facility is found in rule compliance as Youth A went into
confinement for a few hours due to reported medical concerns.
7

This was approved by Nurse due to concerns of Youth A’s
untreated STI and report of being assaulted by police while
pregnant. There was appropriate documentation noted of the
approval of the confinement and staff visual checks every 15
minutes.
Technical Assistance
Consultant provided technical assistance to the facility to make a
clear specific note for the details of confinement. This note should
include who approved the confinement, the why of the
confinement, the start and end time of the confinement, and who
approved the ending of the confinement. Within this investigation
all these items were documented but they were noted in many
different areas, this information should be easily found in one spot.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
